{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3607217,"name":"Ryan Radtke","username":"Ryanforce","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryanforce/{size}/228665_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-29T14:58:33.089Z","cooked":"

I’m trying to set up LaserCAN on my robot, but when I try to import from the libgrapplefrc package on PyPI, nothing seems to be available in the Import (ex: from libgrapplefrc import package name).Am I missing something to use the Grapple library, or is support just not implemented yet?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-04-29T14:58:33.089Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":44.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":500866,"topic_slug":"laser-can-with-robotpy","display_username":"Ryan Radtke","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66385,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5113 Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/laser-can-with-robotpy/500866/1","custom_user_title":"5113 Software Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3607298,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-29T15:52:53.660Z","cooked":"

Well, it seems to have something in it:

>>> import libgrapplefrc
>>> dir(libgrapplefrc)
['LaserCAN', 'LaserCanMeasurement', 'LaserCanRangingMode', 'LaserCanRoi', 'LaserCanTimingBudget', 'MitoCANdria', '__all__', '__builtins__', '__cached__', '__doc__', '__file__', '__loader__', '__name__', '__package__', '__path__', '__spec__', 'can_bridge_tcp', 'libgrapplefrc']

Did you add it to your pyproject.toml and run sync?

But also, see LaserCAN and Python … it might not actually work? I’d recommend contacting the vendor to find out more, presumably they tested it and stuff.

I added it to pyproject.toml and ran sync. That’s why I’m so confused cause there’s something In there but nothing works. I also did see that original post. Do you know how to contact Grapple cause I can’t find anything or would you suggest just reaching out to thrifty bot?

Were you able to make the LaserCan work? I would like to see it working. I am having the same issue you described. If it works, what changes did you have to make to your project? Thanks for any suggestions.

I did figure out how to fix it. I made a wrapper that I added to my teams library that we made. I’m currently working on a pr to add the fix to the actual lib but it’s difficult for me as I have no experience with rust. Here is the link for our lib if you wanna use that. LemonLib/lemonlib at main · FRC5113/LemonLib · GitHub
